parse.title: List of summer schools of linguistics

text.*:
This is a list of summer schools of linguistics.

This list is incomplete; you can help by expanding it.


  •  Germany: European Summer School in Logic, Language and Information (ESSLLI) - Hamburg (2008)[1]
  •  Germany: Summer School on Corpus Phonology - Augsburg (2008)[2]
  •  Greece: The Crete Summer School of Linguistics (CreteLing) - Rethimnon (2017)[3]
  •  Hungary: European Summer School in Generative Grammar (EGG) - Debrecen (2014)[4]
  •  Poland: Summer Institute "Languages and Cultures in Contact / in Contrast" - Zakopane (2008)[5]
  •  Portugal: NOVA - Lisbon Summer School and Graduate Conference in Linguistics - Lisbon[6]
  •  Portugal: U. Minho - APL Summer School of Linguistics 2015: Experimental Methods in Syntax - Braga[7]
  •  United Kingdom: International Summer School in Forensic Linguistic Analysis - Birmingham (2000-2010)[8]
  •  United States: Summer Institute of Linguistics - University of North Dakota (every summer)[9]
  •  United States: Linguistics Society of America Summer Institutes, held in odd-numbered years, including:[10]
    • Empirical Foundations for Theories of Language - Stanford (2007)[11]
    • Linguistic Structure and Language Ecologies - UC Berkeley (2009)[12]
    • Language in the World - University of Colorado at Boulder (2011)[13]
    • Universality and Variability - University of Michigan (2013)[14]
    • Linguistic Theory in a World of Big Data - University of Chicago (2015)[15]
    • Language Across Space and Time - University of Kentucky (2017)[16]
  • InField (Institute on Field Linguistics and Language Documentation) and its successor CoLang (Institute on Collaborative Language Research), held in even-numbered years, including:
    •  United States: InField - University of California, Santa Barbara (2008)[17]
    •  United States: InField - University of Oregon (2010)[18]
    •  United States: CoLang - University of Kansas (2012)[19]
    •  United States: CoLang - University of Texas at Arlington (2014)[20]
    •  United States: CoLang - University of Alaska Fairbanks (2016)[21]
    •  United States: CoLang - University of Florida (2018)
  •  Netherlands: LOT Winter School - Groningen (2009)[22]
  •  Netherlands: LOT Summer School - Leiden (2009)[23]
  •  Netherlands: Utrecht Summer School - Utrecht (2010)[24]
  •  Norway: International Summer School Oslo - Oslo (2011)[25]
  •  Russia: NYI Institute of Linguistics, Cognition and Culture - St. Petersburg[26] every summer since 2003
